subject: Learning
title: Caffeine: The World's Focus Drug
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Caffeine: The World's Focus Drug.

hook.text: Eighty percent of the world's adults use caffeine daily. It's the most popular psychoactive drug on Earth.

buildup.text: Caffeine blocks adenosine receptorsâ€”adenosine is the chemical that builds up to make you feel sleepy.

discovery.text: By blocking sleepiness, caffeine indirectly boosts alertness and sustained attention for 3â€“5 hours.

twist.text: But tolerance builds quickly. Within days, you need caffeine just to feel the attention level you had without it.

climax.text: Caffeine doesn't create energy. It borrows alertness from later, creating a debt you pay with fatigue.

punchline.text: Coffee doesn't give you focus. It delays the bill.

quiz.question: How does caffeine improve alertness?
options: It blocks adenosine receptors that normally make you feel sleepy
